Package com.google.mu.util

Class Substring.Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.mu.util.Substring.Match
  • Enclosing class:
    Substring
    public static final class Substring.Match
extends java.lang.Object
    The result of successfully matching a Substring.Pattern against a string, providing access to the matched substring, to the parts of the string before and after it, and to copies with the matched substring removed or replaced.

    Note: a Substring.Match is a view of the original string and holds a strong reference to the original string. It's advisable to construct and use a Match object within the scope of a method; holding onto a Match object has the same risk of leaking memory as holding onto the string it was produced from.

    Since:
    2.2

      java.lang.String getAfter()
      Returns the part of the original string before the matched substring.
      java.lang.String getBefore()
      Returns the part of the original string before the matched substring.
      int getIndex()
      Returns the starting index of this substring in the containing string.
      int length()
      Returns the length of the matched substring.
      java.lang.String remove()
      Returns a copy of the original string with the matched substring removed.
      java.lang.String replaceWith​(java.lang.CharSequence replacement)
      Returns a copy of the original string with the matched substring replaced with replacement.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the matched substring.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getBefore

        public java.lang.String getBefore()
        Returns the part of the original string before the matched substring.

        getBefore() and getAfter() are almost always used together to split a string into two parts. If you just need the substring before the match, you might want to use Substring.before(pattern) instead, because the pattern logic is encoded entirely in the Substring.Pattern object. For example: 

           private static final Substring.Pattern DIRECTORY = Substring.before(last("/"));

      • getAfter

        public java.lang.String getAfter()
        Returns the part of the original string before the matched substring.

        getBefore() and getAfter() are almost always used together to split a string into two parts. If you just need the substring after the match, you might want to use Substring.after(pattern) instead, because the pattern logic is encoded entirely in the Substring.Pattern object. For example: 

           private static final Substring.Pattern LINE_COMMENT = Substring.after(first("//"));

      • remove

        public java.lang.String remove()
        Returns a copy of the original string with the matched substring removed.

        This is equivalent to match.getBefore() + match.getAfter().

      • replaceWith

        public java.lang.String replaceWith​(java.lang.CharSequence replacement)
        Returns a copy of the original string with the matched substring replaced with replacement.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the starting index of this substring in the containing string.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the matched substring.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the matched substring.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
